answerText: The Bridge[10] The Bridge was written by this American who wrote that the title figure "saw the dice of drowned men's bones bequeath an embassy" in his poem "At Melville's Tomb."
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 3 | 18 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In its last section "Atlantis," the author described this work's title object as "Answerer of all" and as a "pervasive Paradigm." For 10 points each: [10] Name this epic poem split into 15 parts. It begins with a "Proem" and also contains a section that envisions Whitman walking along a beach, "Cape Hatteras."
